content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Chandler is sitting in the living room as Monica enters.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hey.
(Monica notices something.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh my God! You cleaned! (Gasps) Look at these floors! You did the windows! Oh, I have been begging you for months and you did! You cleaned! And nagging works!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Y’know uh, I didn’t actually do this.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no, was I cleaning in my sleep again?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: No, it wasn’t you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well then who?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I got a maid. Yay!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I hope by maid you mean mistress, because if some other woman was here cleaning then…

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Uh honey, I know you don’t like to relinquish control…

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, relinquish is just a fancy word for lose!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Look, she’s really nice. Okay? And she mentioned that she adored the way that you arranged the sponges.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did she really say that?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes, I distinctly remember ‘cause I thought it was a joke. Now just give her a chance, okay?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fine, I can do it. (Gets anxious.) Whew.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What’s the matter?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Well, usually when I’m this anxious, I clean!

content.description: Central Perk, Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are there as someone’s cell phone starts to ring with one of those fancy ring tones.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Who’s cell phone is that? It’s just so annoying; everywhere you go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I think it’s coming from your bag.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I never get calls!! (Answers the phone) Hello?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Hi, it’s Eric. From the Halloween party, Ursula’s fianc�e.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God Eric hi! Wait, how’d you get this number?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Oh, I have a friend who’s a cop and he got it for me.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Wow! What an incredible violation—and wonderful surprise.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Uh listen, I just—I thought you should know I broke up with Ursula.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh you did? (To Rachel) He did it! He did it!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! What did he do?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Shhh! I’m talking.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Anyway, I was wondering if, you were the sort of person who…eats lunch.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Are you asking me out? ‘Cause it would be kinda weird since you just broke up with my sister.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Yeah uh…okay. I’m-I’m sorry. Bye.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No! Wait! I was just saying that so you’d think I was a good person. Fight for me.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Uhh, I won’t take no for an answer.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Not great, but we can work on it at lunch. Okay, I can be at your apartment in two hours.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Great! But wh-wh—How do you know where I live?

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: I’ve got friends too. Okay, bye.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Bye.
(She hangs up.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh my God! I’m going out with Eric! Ooh, this day is really gonna be so much better than I thought it was gonna be. Oh Ross, I can’t make lunch. (Exits.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So apparently I’m available for lunch.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I can’t. I’m busy. I’m apartment hunting.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: You’re moving?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah, I can’t live with Joey once the baby comes. I don’t want my child’s first words to be, (in a baby’s voice) “How you doin’?”

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: So does-does Joey know you’re moving?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well, I haven’t discussed it with him yet, but I know he’s gonna be relieved. Last week, he brought this girl over and I started talking to her about morning sickness and then I showed her pictures from my pregnancy book.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: That’s not really porn.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Not so much.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hey, y’know what and if you’re looking for a place? I just heard in the elevator this morning that a woman in my building died.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh my God! Was she old? Does she have a view?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well I don’t know, but how-how great would that be huh? You living in my building. I could help take care of the baby. I can come over whenever I want. (Rachel looks at him.) With your permission.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Yeah that would really be great.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Well can we see it?! Oh maybe we shouldn’t. I mean if she just died this morning out of respect.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah. No. No you’re right.
(Pause as they both take another sip of coffee.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Shall we?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah.
(They both exit.)

content.description: Ross’s Building, they are approaching the apartment of the woman who died. Ross knocks on the door and a woman answers it.

content.speaker: Mrs. Verhoeven’s Daughter
content.text: Yes?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. I’m Ross Geller. I live in the building.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: And I’m Rachel, an admirer of the building.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: I-I heard about Mrs. Verhoeven passing away and I’m so sorry for your loss.

content.speaker: Mrs. Verhoeven’s Daughter
content.text: She didn’t pass.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Mrs. Verhoeven’s Daughter
content.text: My mother’s still alive.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh, thank God!

content.speaker: Mrs. Verhoeven’s Daughter
content.text: It looked like we were gonna lose her this morning, but she’s a tough old bird.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ahh.

content.speaker: Mrs. Verhoeven’s Daughter
content.text: Are you close with her?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Of course! Uh yeah, she and I would talk all the time in-in (Rachel pokes her head in and starts to look around) the laundry room. (Pushes Rachel out of the way.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Verhoeven’s Daughter
content.text: You speak Dutch? (In Dutch) Zeer vereerd een vriend van mijn moeder te ontmoeten. (Translation: I’m very honored to meet a friend of my mother.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Y’know I would it’s just painful.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: So she’s really not dead.

content.speaker: Mrs. Verhoeven’s Daughter
content.text: No, she’s hanging in there.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hmm. Do you think—Could you tell me if she’s hanging in, in a one bedroom or a two?

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Monica is observing the new maid, Brenda, clean.

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: Mrs. Bing, this tile cleaner is incredible! Where’d you get it?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh well umm, I make it myself! It’s two parts ammonia and one part lemon juice. And now the secret ingredient is…y’know what? We just met.

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: Okay. Uhh, I’m gonna go get the clothes from the laundry room now. And, when I come back I’ll clean behind the refrigerator.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I love her.

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: I’ll be back in a minute.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Okay. (As Brenda exits Monica notices something.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: See? I told you.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: She stole my jeans!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I have been looking for them all week and she is wearing them!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So she stole your pants and then she came back and wore them in front of you?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Don’t you see? It’s the perfect crime!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: She must’ve been planning this for years!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I will prove it to you! Okay? About a week ago I was wearing those jeans and I dropped a pen in my lap and it left an ink stain on the crotch. Now when she comes back I will find it and show you that stain!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Honey, isn’t it possible that the company that sold the jeans made more than just the one pair?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I guess.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: So, shouldn’t we go give her the benefit of the doubt before we go…snooping around her crotch?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fine. I’m just glad I didn’t give her my secret ingredient.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Out of curiosity, what is your secret ingredient?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yeah! (Laughs.)

content.description: Eric’s Apartment, he’s opening the door to reveal Phoebe.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Come in, I’m so glad you’re here.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, me too. Not in the shaky angry way you are though.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Sorry, I just saw Ursula. I had to give the engagement ring back.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Just seeing her brought it all back. All the lies, the way she used me. I just…I got so angry just looking at her…(Looks at Phoebe)…face.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah. (Covers her face with her hand.) Yeah.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: I’m sorry. I just…when I look at you I see her. When I see her I get a little bit angry.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Maybe this is too weird.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: No wait! There’s only a problem when I look at you. (Sits down on the couch.) Oh I got it! I got it. (Puts his hands to his eyes.)

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No don’t tear out your eyes!!

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: I was just, I was just gonna take out my lenses.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh, yeah try that. (He finishes and looks at her.) So, is that better?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Not really. You…you’re blurry, but you still look like Ursula. You’re Blursula. Okay wait. Maybe…If I-if I just don’t look at you for a while. (Stands up and turns his back to her.) See? It…it works. I’m not, I’m not angry at all anymore! This is a great date!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Look Eric, turn around. (He does so.) Look, I like you, but it shouldn’t be this hard. Y’know? This is our first date y’know? First dates are supposed to be about excitement and electricity and ‘Ooh, he just touched my hand, did he mean to touch my hand?’ and y’know first kisses and…(He kisses her)…second kisses. (Motions for him to kiss her again which he does and they start to make out.)

content.description: Central Perk, Ross is reading some book and Gunther serves him a cup of coffee.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Thanks for the coffee, or bedankt voor de koffie, Gunter. (He translates that phrase into Dutch.)

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Jij spreekt Nederlands? Dat is te gek. Heb je familie daar? (Translation: You speak Dutch That’s cool. Do you have relatives there?)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, we’re done.

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Ezel. (Translation: Donkey)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ezel? Ezel? Ezel? (Looks it up in his book.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey Ross! Listen, do you want to go see that new Imax movie on tide pools?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Really?!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No. But I got Knicks tickets for you, me, and Chandler.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Sweet!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: All right, well finish your coffee; let’s go.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Okay I-I just have to stop by my place first.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: To tape the game? You do this every time Ross, you’re not gonna be on TV!

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: No-no, I-I have to see if this apartment became available.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, you’re switching apartments?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: It’s not for me, it’s for Rachel.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: But Rachel has an apartment.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, but when the baby comes she’s gonna want to move.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: She is?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Yeah, you didn’t expect her to live there with a baby did you?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I guess I didn’t really think about it.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ezel! (Reads the translation.) Hey Gunther! You’re an ezel!
content.parenthetical: finds the word in the book

content.speaker: Gunther
content.text: Jij hebt seks met ezels. (Translation: You have sex with donkeys.)

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Damnit!

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Brenda is sweeping and Monica is sitting at the kitchen table.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Nice jeans!

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: Oh thanks! I like your top.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh. (Holds on to it.) (To herself) You’re not gettin’ it.
(Brenda bends down to use the dustpan and Monica leans over to look for the stain, but leans so far over she falls out of the chair.)

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: What happened?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, I fell asleep.

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: I was thinking about taking my lunch break.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh, will you do the top of the cabinets? That’ll really work up your appetite for lunch.

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: All right.

(Brenda pulls a chair to the counter and uses it to get up on the counter in order to clean the top of the cabinets. Monica sneaks over, bends over, and tries to see the stain. That doesn’t work so she sticks her head between Brenda’s legs. Suddenly Brenda changes her stance and traps Monica’s head between her legs.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hello.

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: What’s going on?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I’m sorry. I’ve never had a maid before, is this not okay?

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel is eating pizza as Joey returns from the Knicks game.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: How was the game?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Oh, okay. I…I ate way too much.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh. (Notices the pizza, grabs a slice, and takes a bite.) So umm, I was talkin’ to Ross and he said you were looking for a new place.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh yeah! Hopefully across the street if certain Dutch people would just let go.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I was kinda hoping you’d stay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Oh but Joey, I have to go. There’s no room for a baby here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: No room? It’s a baby. It’s like this big. (Holds his hands about a foot apart.) Y’know, I mean you-you could you could put it over here. (A desk.) Or-or-or we could put it right here. (The chair.) Aw, it’s cute, right? Or-or we could put it over here. (By the bathroom door.) You wouldn’t even notice it. Where’s the baby? (Mumbles that it’s over in the corner.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, it’s not just a matter of where you put it. I mean a baby changes everything. They cry all the time. I mean imagine bringing home some girl and trying to score when there’s a screaming baby around.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I could use a challenge! It’s getting pretty easy.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Honey, it’s so sweet that you want me to stay, but I-I can’t do that to you. I mean it would disrupt your entire life.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I love living with you so much. I just wish things didn’t have to change.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I know.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Y’know I blame Ross for this.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I do too a little bit.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m gonna miss you, you’re the hottest roommate I ever had.

content.description: Eric’s Apartment, he and Phoebe are still making out.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ooh, oh no! I have to go! I have a massage appointment.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Oh no, stay here we’ll keep doing this. I’ll pay you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: No, I got in trouble for that before. I’ll see you later.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Absolutely. (They kiss and Phoebe heads for the door.) I love the way you kiss.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Really? That’s the thing I’m worse at! You’ll see. (Exits.)

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Brenda is shaking out the rugs on the balcony as Monica pouts in the living room.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Hey! Umm, I think Brenda needs a raise.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: How come?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Because I put my head between her legs.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: To see her pants?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: They’re my pants!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Are you sure? Did you see the stain?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No! I was just getting into position and then everything went dark.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: God! She is not stealing from us! Okay, will you let this go?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Fine. (Brenda comes in to use the bathroom and adjusts her pink bra strap on the way.) She’s wearing my bra!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Oh dear God!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: My pink flowered bra! I recognize the strap!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: And yet you don’t recognize that you’re crazy.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Here’s the plan! Okay? I’m going to leave you get a look at Brenda’s bra!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Here’s another plan…No!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: I would do it but she thinks I’m attracted to her!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Did you not hear where my head was? Come on! Come on we’re a team! We’re in this together!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I fear a jury will see it the same way!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do this for me! Come on, I catch you looking at woman’s breasts all the time!

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You see that?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Do you see this? (Mimics him drooling over a woman’s breasts.)

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: All right. Yes. Okay. I get your point. But if it’s not your bra will you just let the woman clean the apartment?!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Yes! Absolutely. Okay? Look, you’ll know it’s mine because on the right cup, the lacey part, there’s a very noticeable rip.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You need new clothes.

content.description: Mrs. Verhoeven’s Apartment, Ross is back to inquire about the elder Verhoeven’s health or lack there of.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Hi. How is she?

content.speaker: Mrs. Verhoeven’s Daughter
content.text: It’s not looking good.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh. (Realizes then sadly) Oh. Well I uh, I brought her some bloemen. (Flowers in Dutch.)

content.speaker: Mrs. Verhoeven’s Daughter
content.text: That’s so sweet. (Takes the flowers.) Would you like to come in and say good-bye? I’m sure it would mean a lot to her.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Oh I don’t know that it would.

content.speaker: Mrs. Verhoeven’s Daughter
content.text: Well, her memory is pretty much gone.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: All right then. (Follows her in and checks the place out.)

content.description: Eric’s Apartment, he’s resting on the bed as Phoebe enters.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey!

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Welcome back!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Hey! (Jumps on the bed with him.) Can we pick up where we left off?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: I don’t know, I’m still pretty tired out from this afternoon.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Why?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Uh, the sex.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: What sex?

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Our sex.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: We didn’t have sex.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Well if I didn’t have sex with you, I had sex with someone that looked an awful lot like…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Ew! Ew! Ew! Ew! Ew! Ew!

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Oh no! Oh no! Oh no! Oh no! No! No! No!

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You-you…you had sex with Ursula?!

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Uh, a little bit. She-she-she walked in and I thought she was you and I kissed her and…

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: You didn’t notice she was wearing different clothes?!

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Well I was just so excited to see you.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Oh. Ew! Ew! Ew! Ugh! Y’know what? This is too weird.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: No-no it’s not! I don’t want to lose you! It’s-it’s like I was saying to Ursula when I was making love to her and I thought she was you—Yeah it is too weird.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: So I guess this is it.

content.speaker: Eric
content.text: Yeah. (They hug.) Maybe it’s for the best. You smell just like her.

content.speaker: Phoebe
content.text: Yeah, so do you.

content.description: Monica and Chandler’s, Brenda is wiping the coffee table and Chandler is trying to look at her bra and leans over on the coffee table to get a good look.

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: What are you doing?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I’m leaning. This is where I lean.

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: Okay. (Goes over and fluffs up the pillows on the couch.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Brenda a bee!

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: What?

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: Yes! It’s flown into your blouse and you’d better undo your buttons lest it sting you!

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: I think I know what’s going on here.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: You do?

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: Look, I know it must be hard that your wife is a lesbian, but it’s wrong. You’re married.

content.speaker: Chandler
content.text: I totally understand. (They both laugh.) Can I just see your bra?

content.description: The Hallway, Monica is sitting on the step as Rachel returns.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Hi!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Where did you get those jeans?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You gave them to me!

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: No I didn’t!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: All right, I took them. But I figured it would be okay because you got a big ink stain on the crotch.

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Oh no! Did you take my bra too?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What bra?

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: The pink one with the flowers?!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You mean the one that you’re wearing? (Adjusts Monica’s pink bra strap as Monica looks down her shirt.)

content.speaker: Brenda
content.text: I quit! (Storms off.)

content.speaker: Monica
content.text: Sounds about right.

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Rachel enters and notices that Joey has set up a space for the baby where the couch was, complete with a crib.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What is this?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hey! Uh, this is just to give you an idea. Okay well, we can put screens here, (In front of the crib.) so that the baby has privacy, and-and-and maybe a mobile over the crib. And uh—Oh look! Here’s a baby monitor (Holds it up), which until the baby comes we can use as walkie-talkies. Huh?

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: You’re so sweet. (Notices something in the crib.) Oh my God! And you gave the baby Hugsy! (A stuffed penguin wearing a ski jacket, goggles, and hat.)

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ahhhhhhhhhhhh… That-that-that’s really just to show where the baby would go. Y’know why don’t I hold on to him so that there’s no confusion? (Takes him back, sets him on the chair, and apologizes to him.)

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: But Joey the baby is going to be crying, it’s going to be loud.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m loud!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s gonna be up all night!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I’m up all night!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s gonna poop!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Hello!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: What about all the women you want to bring home?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Look, if I’m bringing home a woman who can’t stand being around a baby, then maybe I don’t want to be with that woman! Or maybe we’ll just do it in the bathroom of the club!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Joey, are you sure?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah! All right—Look, I know sometimes it’ll be hard, okay? But, it’ll also be really…really great. Please Rachel! I-I-I really want you to stay.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: I want me to stay too.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ohh!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Thank you. (They hug.) Oh Joey and look at this crib! It’s so cute!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I know! I found it on the street.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Are you serious—Really?! It’s in such good condition.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Yeah.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Wow! Whoa-whoa what’s under the covers?

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: I don’t know.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s moving.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ew.

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: It’s still—(Screams)—It’s got a tail! Get it out of here! Get it out of here!!

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Ooh! Ah! Okay! (Quickly drags the crib outside.)

content.description: Joey and Rachel’s, Joey and Rachel are toasting her staying put.

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Well, the old lady died. And how do I know? Her dying wish was for one last kiss. But I don’t care, (To Rachel) because you got the apartment. Yes!

content.speaker: Rachel
content.text: Ewww. Yeah. Umm. I think I’m gonna stay here.

content.speaker: Joey
content.text: Isn’t that great?

content.speaker: Ross
content.text: Ezels!!
